alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 5:33PM EDT until September 28 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated another feeder band developing over southern Miami-Dade County that will be moving northwest into the flood advisory area during the next couple of hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with this feeder band on top of the already 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen from the previous feeder bands. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Miami Beach, Plantation, Sunrise, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Coral Gables, South Miami, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea and Surfside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
